intro: Hieracium fosheimense, commonly known as the Fosheim's hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium fosheimense is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting well to dry conditions.
